title: President's Council on Sports, Fitness, and Nutrition

enrichment.summary: This executive order renames and updates the President's Council on Physical Fitness and Sports to the President's Council on Sports, Fitness, and Nutrition. It directs the Department of Health and Human Services to develop a national strategy to increase youth participation in sports, promote physical activity and good nutrition, especially focusing on underserved communities. The order establishes the Council's membership, functions, and administrative support to advise the President and promote healthier lifestyles for Americans.
potential_concerns: The focus on expanding youth sports participation may fail to adequately address barriers faced by children with disabilities, despite mention of consideration, potentially limiting their inclusion and benefit.

Targeting low-income and food-insecure populations may uncover funding and resource challenges that hinder equitable access to nutritional programs and athletic facilities in underserved urban and rural communities.

Emphasizing youth sports participation risks unintentionally privileging traditional team sports, which could exacerbate existing gender disparities affecting girls and women’s access to sports opportunities.

The national strategy’s reliance on volunteer recruitment might be insufficient in economically distressed areas, creating gaps in program delivery and support for youth engagement in physical activity and nutrition.
